Constant Field Values

useTimezoneSeparator_KEY

public static final java.lang.String useTimezoneSeparator_KEY
Java default ISO date format, timezone specified with out separator (E.g 2010-11-24T17:23:10+0100) last time zone part specified with out ':' separtor. To add separator between hour and minute part of timezone useTimezoneSeparator set to true. If useTimezoneSeparator =true data with ISO format written in json as 2010-11-24T17:23:10+01:00 FYI: both with separator (+01:00) or with out separator (+0100) are valid according to ISO date format.
Property name (jsonservice.properties): json.date.iso.useTimezoneSeparator
Default: false

See Also:
Constant Field Values

useTimezoneSeparator

public static boolean useTimezoneSeparator

dateFormat_KEY

public static final java.lang.String dateFormat_KEY
Date format used in JSON input and output. All java.util.Date, Calender and Timestamp use specified format. For available format look at com.jaxws.json.DateFormat
Property name (jsonservice.properties): com.jaxws.json.DateFormat
Default: DateFormat.PLAIN

dateFormat

public static DateFormat dateFormat

responsePayloadEnabled_KEY

public static final java.lang.String responsePayloadEnabled_KEY
Response Payload name (Operation response Name) enabled in JSON response. E.g. Operation called "getVersion" which returns response object "versionInfo". This response object warped with operation object. When set to json.response.enable.payloadname=true: Request: {"getVersion":{"requestContext":{"token":""}}} Response: {"getVersionXXX":{"versionInfo":{"version":"1.0","buildDate":"1290612232525","releaseDate":"1290612232525"}}} "getVersionXXX" is a response element name defined in wsdl. When set to json.response.enable.payloadname=false Response: {"versionInfo":{"version":"1.0","buildDate":"1290612232525","releaseDate":"1290612232525"}}
Property name (jsonservice.properties): json.response.enable.payloadname
Default: false This property normally true for better automated testing. In application suggested to be false.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

responsePayloadEnabled

public static boolean responsePayloadEnabled

excludeNullProperties_KEY

public static final java.lang.String excludeNullProperties_KEY
Null values are ignored in JSON response when set to true. E.g: when set to false: {"versionInfo":{"version":"null","buildDate":"34234234"}} E.g: when set to true: {"versionInfo":{"buildDate":"34234234"}} since value of version is null it is ignored in json output.
Property name (jsonservice.properties): json.excludeNullProperties
Default: true

See Also:
In case of null value with createDefaultOnNonNullable is true new object created. In case of primitive with no default value end with null, these null value response determined by excludeNullProperties, Constant Field Values

excludeNullProperties

public static boolean excludeNullProperties

createDefaultOnNonNullable_KEY

public static final java.lang.String createDefaultOnNonNullable_KEY
Null or non present values in JOSN request are non nullable in server, in this case create empty object. E.e {"getUser":{}} version part of getUser call user object/id marked as nullable false in XSD. But in JSON sending null or non present. This case up on enable this flag, In case of object new instance created and assigned, IN case of primitive with xsd default, default value populated. Applicable only for beans. In case of primitive with default value is xsd always populated.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

createDefaultOnNonNullable

public static boolean createDefaultOnNonNullable

gzip_KEY

public static final java.lang.String gzip_KEY
JSON response written as gzip encoded format. It's dependent on Accept-content: type header in http request. When set to true response return as gzip if client send Accept-Encoding with gzip true.
Property name (jsonservice.properties): json.response.gzip
Default: true

See Also:
Constant Field Values

gzip

public static boolean gzip

excludeProperties_KEY

public static final java.lang.String excludeProperties_KEY
List of excluded properties, User can add one or more with regex format. E.e json.exclude.serialVersionUID=serialVersionUID
Property name (jsonservice.properties): json.exclude.xxx
Default: empty. All are included

See Also:
Constant Field Values

excludeProperties

public static final java.util.Collection<java.util.regex.Pattern> excludeProperties

includeProperties_KEY

public static final java.lang.String includeProperties_KEY
List of included properties, User can add one with regex format. By specifying include property, properties which are not matching to include are ignored in json output.
Property name (jsonservice.properties): json.include
Default: empty.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

includeProperties

public static java.util.Collection<java.util.regex.Pattern> includeProperties

listWrapperSkip_KEY

public static final java.lang.String listWrapperSkip_KEY
In JAXB generated object list sequence generated with warped object. Seralizing it to json end with unnessary objects. To avoid it user can set listWrapperSkip=true. Eg: In XSF Above XSD lead to java object as Items{ List getItems(){ return } } Result JSON representation of items looks like when listWrapperSkip set to false. {"items": {"item":[...]} } In most case java script developers don't prefer to have two object names. Result JSON representation of items looks like when listWrapperSkip set to true. {"items":[..]}
Property name (jsonservice.properties): json.list.wrapperSkip
Default: false.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

listWrapperSkip

public static boolean listWrapperSkip

globalMapKeyPattern_KEY

public static final java.lang.String globalMapKeyPattern_KEY
Match pattern which convert lists to MAP. TODO

public static final java.lang.String ENCODER
List of custom encoder used to handle non JSON response. User can register customized encoder like HTML, plain text etc output.
